intro: Centaurea popovici-hatzegi, commonly known as the Hatzegi centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region of Romania. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
